BY ADV. SRI.PETER M. PAUL leet mee oa [ca] iy 2020/KER/265 Crl.M.C. No.9265 of 2019 2 RESPONDENTS /COMPLAINANT & STATE: 1 DENCY, W/O.TONY, AGED 55 YEARS, 12/474 Cc, BRAHMAKULAM, KAREPARAMBIL HOUSE, POOCHETTY, ERAVIMANGALAM, AYYAPPANKAVU.P.O., TRICHUR- 680751, NADATHARA VILLAGE. 2 STATE OF KERALA, REP. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA. R1 BY ADV. C.A.DIVYA SRI .AMJED ALI PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: a ap 2020/KER/265 Crl.M.C. No.9265 of 2019 3 Cri.M.C. No.9265 of 2019 ORDER This is a proceedings instituted under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing the proceedings in C.C.No.243 of 2019 on the files of the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Ill, Thrissur. 2. The petitioners are the accused in the said case. The said case was instituted upon a private complaint lodged by the first respondent under Sections 465, 467, 469 and 471 read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 3. It is seen that the occurrence referred to above is one arose on account of the estranged matrimonial relationship between the first petitioner and the son of the first respondent. It is also seen that the petitioners and the first respondent have settled their disputes, and an affidavit to that effect has been filed by the first respondent. 4. The learned counsel for the first respondent affirms that the affidavit is one sworn to by the first respondent and submits that the first respondent has no objection in ae fl aa 2020/KER/265 Crl.M.C. No.9265 of 2019 4 granting the relief sought for by the petitioners. 5. In the light of the decisions of the Apex Court in Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303, Narinder singh v. State of Punjab, (2014) 6 SCC 466 and Jitendra Raghuvanshi & Others v. Babita Raghuvanshi & Another, (2013) 4 SCC 58, | am of the view that this is an appropriate case where this court has to invoke the jurisdiction under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings against the petitioners. In the result, the Crl.M.C. is allowed and the proceedings in C.C.No.243 of 2019 on the files of the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Ill, Thrissur are quashed. Sd/- P.B.SURESH KUMAR, JUDGE YKB ERNE co Ei iw 2020/KER/265 Crl.M.C. No.9265 of 2019 5 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE Al THE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE COMPLAINT FILED BY THE RESPONDENT J.F.C.
